page.title: 03FOCUS ON M62 MOTORWAY (2)
page.content: Before the M62 Motorway was built, the motorists had to use longer routes, mainly the "A"roads to travel. However, another form of transport which was very popular in the early years, was by Barge,along the Aire and Calder Navigation. This leaves the River Aire at Knottingley and practically runs along side the M62 through Whitley Bridge. This form of transport is rarely used now. Another road which has recently been built to cut the numbers of drivers using the small streets of the village, is the by pass which joins the M62 to the A19. The people in the village say that the by-pass is a good thing, as local traffic is a lot quieter since it has been built.
